page.title: 06Transport, Warbleton
page.content: Our survey showed that 4 out of 5 households have at least one car, with 2 in 5 having 2 or more vehicles. Those with no transport rely,not only on the infrequent buses, but also on taxis, bicycles and the goodwill of friends. Three separate bus companies run services into Rushlake Green. From the south there is a roughly two hourly service from Eastbourne via Hailsham and Cowbeech. During school term time this service is extended twice a day to take and collect children from Heathfield Secondary school. A less frequent bus runs through Punnets Town to Battle. Rail travellers have an hourly opportunity to catch trains at Etchingham, Stonegate or Robertsbridge on the Hastings to London line. The nearest airport is Gatwick which can be reached by road in about an hour.
